page.title: 01NORTH WEST AREA I.O.WIGHT
page.content: The North West Area of the Isle of Wight encompasses the western River Yar,the old town of Yarmouth;the large parish of Freshwater and the hamlet of Norton. The coast line between Yarmouth common and Totland Bay; sadly subject to coastal erosion in the most westerly area, has 3 piers though Fort Victoria and Totland are in bad repair and no longer used. We have 3 Victorian forts, Golden Hill; Albert and Victoria. The area, with 4 holiday camps caters largely for the tourist industry.Yarmouth is the most westerly of the 3 ports of entry with an hourly ferry service in winter; half hourly in summer bringing in passengers,cars and freight. Excursion boats from the mainland bring visitors to the pier and town in the summer.
